design_audit.model_formula: mutual ~ mlaw + slaw + regulate + nfc + reform + refmlaw + refslaw + refregulate + refnfc + ten2 + ten3 + ten4 + ten5, cluster(state)
design_audit.selection_story: Cross-sectional variation in state insurance regulation explains organizational form choice (mutual vs stock) of insurance companies formed 1900-1949

claim_object.treatment_concept: State regulatory environment: mutual financial requirement (mlaw), stock financial requirement (slaw), and regulatory dummies (regulate, nfc) plus reform interactions
claim_object.estimand_concept: Association between state regulation variables and probability of mutual organizational form, conditional on decade effects
claim_object.target_population: Insurance companies formed in the United States, 1900-1949 (N=881)

constraints.functional_form_note: Baseline uses logit; LPM is a natural robustness check that preserves the claim object
linkage_notes: Reform interaction terms (refmlaw, refslaw, refregulate, refnfc) mechanically linked to reform -- dropping reform while keeping interactions is incoherent
Favor specs replace mlaw/slaw with favor and use reffavor instead of refmlaw/refslaw -- these are substitute treatment measures
Decade dummies (ten2-ten5) and rcorp serve similar time-control roles; paper uses one or the other
clogit with group(state) automatically drops 13 states (131 obs) with all-stock or all-mutual outcomes
excluded_from_core: explore/form/treatment/mlaw_binary -- dichotomizing continuous mlaw at median changes coefficient interpretation
explore/form/treatment/slaw_binary -- dichotomizing continuous slaw at median changes coefficient interpretation
explore/form/treatment/favor_binary -- dichotomizing favor changes coefficient interpretation

canonical.notes: Cluster-robust SEs at state level (47 clusters), matching the paper's baseline inference
